primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Triune God intervenes in the human condition of being under a curse by having the Son take the curse upon himself as a substitute, thereby redeeming humanity.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father and Son in one will)

God has intervened by coming between us and his own decree
Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law
to obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ
redeemed us from the curse of the law

zender.identificatie: The Love of the Father and Son / The Divine Decree
tekstueel_bewijs: the love of the Father and Son together determined that we should not perish
on our behalf and in our place
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies strictly as the Receiver/Beneficiary.

helper.identificatie: The Cross / The Law (as a diagnostic tool)
tekstueel_bewijs: this passage from Galatians gives us the most succinct and compelling view
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit; the Spirit is the one making the understanding 'sink into our hearts'.

tekstueel_bewijs: the rightful wrath of God against Sin
we are constitutionally unable to keep God's law
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is an ontological and legal 'curse' that humanity is 'constitutionally unable' to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the redeemed: gratitude and praise.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is a strictly non-meritorious response to the completed action of the primary program.

we will be overwhelmed with gratitude

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon centers on human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) met by divine 'pouvoir' (intervention). Grace is the endowment of a result the human subject could not achieve.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (the curse we are under) through ~S1 (the failure of works) to ~S2 (Christ becoming the curse) to arrive at S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ occupying the position of S2 so the Receiver can occupy S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the curse is described as a 'rightful wrath' and a 'sweeping violation'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is a textbook example of theocentric preaching. God is the subject of all salvific verbs, and the human role is defined by inability and reception.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He must, therefore, have been taking upon himself the curse that belonged to someone else.
we... indeed, cannot obey or fulfil God's commandments.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as models for behavior but as participants in a cosmic drama.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading of Paul and Jesus.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and gratitude; removal of the burden of performance.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative hierarchy is perfectly maintained: Soteriology (what God did) precedes and produces Ethics (gratitude).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: taking upon himself the curse that belonged to someone else

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the work of the Father and Son; the Spirit's role is implied in the 'sinking into hearts'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Fatal; it incurs a divine curse that requires a divine death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative structure is robustly theocentric. The Subject (God) acts upon the Object (Curse) to benefit the Receiver (Man).

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The lack of 'Devoir' for the hearer is theologically intentional here.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (The Curse) is already maximized.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the Gospel. It avoids all moralistic traps by grounding human identity in 'the slave' who receives and God in the 'Subject' who redeems.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the Kosovo imagery; Greimas shows that the Kosovo imagery serves to define the 'Opponent' as a 'blasphemous' force that only a 'Subject-switch' can solve.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Galatians 3; Greimas shows how the sermon's 'engine' mirrors the substitutionary logic of the text.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the sermon's power comes from the hearer being placed in the 'Receiver' slot, preventing the 'Exemplarism' that often ruins Good Friday preaching.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Wrathful Father vs. Innocent Son' dichotomy by making the Trinity the collective Subject.
